title: Networking Roles and Topologies
math: networking roles, client-server, peer-to-peer, LAN, WAN, MAN, PAN, bus, star, ring, mesh, physical topology, logical topology
note: Explain client-server vs peer-to-peer, and compare LAN/WAN scopes and common topologies (bus, star, ring, mesh) including physical vs logical layouts. Demonstrate using Cisco Packet Tracer 8.x or GNS3 on Windows 11/Ubuntu 22.04.

title: Binary, Hex, and Data Units
math: binary, hexadecimal, bits, bytes, kibibyte, mebibyte, throughput, bandwidth, latency, goodput
note: Teach binary/hex conversions and relate bits/bytes to data rates. Contrast bandwidth, latency, and goodput with simple calculations. Use Python 3.11 REPL in Windows Terminal or Ubuntu 22.04.

title: OSI Model Deep Dive
math: OSI layers, encapsulation, decapsulation, PDU types, services
note: Describe the seven OSI layers and PDU names. Map devices and protocols to layers. Use Wireshark 4 on Windows 11 to inspect a captured HTTP request and annotate each layer.

title: TCP/IP Model Mapping
math: TCP/IP layers, protocol suite, OSI mapping
note: Explain the four/five-layer TCP/IP model, core protocols, and how it maps to OSI. Use Wireshark on Ubuntu 22.04 to correlate headers to TCP/IP layers.

title: Encapsulation and PDUs
math: frames, packets, segments, encapsulation, MTU, MSS, fragmentation
note: Show how data is encapsulated into segments, packets, and frames. Demonstrate MTU, MSS, and fragmentation using ping with DF flag in PowerShell (Windows 11) and iputils (Ubuntu 22.04).

title: Ethernet and MAC Addressing
math: Ethernet II, MAC addressing, CSMA/CD, frame format
note: Detail Ethernet frame fields and MAC addressing. Explain CSMA/CD and full-duplex. Build a tiny GNS3 lab with Open vSwitch and FRRouting hosts; observe frames in Wireshark.

title: IPv4 Addressing Basics
math: IPv4 classes, private ranges, APIPA, dotted decimal
note: Introduce IPv4 addressing, private ranges, and APIPA. Configure static IPv4 addresses on Windows 11 and Ubuntu 22.04 and verify with ipconfig and ip addr.

title: Subnetting Fundamentals
math: subnet masks, binary math, borrowed bits, host counts, network ID, broadcast
note: Calculate subnets by hand: network ID, broadcast, and usable hosts. Practice with paper worksheets and validate using a short Python 3.11 script on Windows or Linux.

title: CIDR and VLSM Planning
math: CIDR notation, VLSM, summarization, supernetting
note: Design a VLSM plan for diverse host counts and create route summaries. Use a spreadsheet template and verify with ipcalc on Ubuntu 22.04.

title: IPv6 Addressing Basics
math: IPv6 notation, zero compression, address types, scope, multicast
note: Teach IPv6 notation (hextets, zero compression) and address scopes (global, link-local, unique-local, multicast). Configure static IPv6 on Ubuntu 22.04 and validate with ip -6 commands.

title: IPv6 NDP and Autoconfiguration
math: NDP, SLAAC, DHCPv6, DAD, Router Advertisement
note: Explain NDP components, SLAAC vs DHCPv6, and duplicate address detection. In GNS3 with FRRouting, send router advertisements and inspect neighbor tables on Linux hosts.

title: Ports and Protocols
math: TCP vs UDP, three-way handshake, connection states, well-known ports
note: Memorize and test common ports (DNS, DHCP, HTTP/S, SSH, RDP, SNMP). Use Wireshark and netcat on Windows 11 and Ubuntu to demonstrate TCP handshakes and UDP traffic.

title: ARP and Neighbor Caches
math: ARP, gratuitous ARP, ARP cache, IPv6 neighbor cache
note: Describe ARP resolution, gratuitous ARP, and cache behavior; compare to IPv6 neighbor caches. Use arp -a on Windows and ip neigh/ndisc6 on Linux to observe entries.

title: Switching Fundamentals
math: MAC learning, flooding, CAM table, collision domains
note: Explain MAC learning and forwarding behavior in switches. Build a three-switch lab in GNS3 with Open vSwitch and review CAM-like tables via ovs-appctl.

title: VLANs and Trunking
math: VLANs, 802.1Q tagging, native VLAN, access port, trunk port
note: Create VLANs, set access/trunk ports, and configure native VLAN. Use Cisco IOSv or Open vSwitch in GNS3 and validate isolation with ping tests.

title: Inter-VLAN Routing
math: router-on-a-stick, SVIs, default gateways
note: Route between VLANs using router-on-a-stick and switch virtual interfaces. Configure on Cisco IOSv in GNS3 and verify with traceroute and gateway checks.

title: Spanning Tree Protocol
math: STP, RSTP, BPDUs, root bridge, port roles, port states
note: Prevent loops with STP/RSTP, choose a root bridge, and observe port roles/states. Use Cisco IOSv switches in GNS3 and show spanning-tree outputs.

title: Link Aggregation (LACP)
math: 802.3ad, LACP, EtherChannel, hashing algorithms
note: Bundle links with LACP for redundancy and throughput. Configure EtherChannel on Cisco IOSv in GNS3 and test failure scenarios by disabling member links.

title: Wireless RF Basics
math: RF, wavelength, attenuation, multipath, SNR, modulation
note: Introduce RF concepts: path loss, multipath, and SNR. Visualize signals using Acrylic Wi-Fi Home or NetSpot on Windows 11.

title: 802.11 Standards and Channels
math: 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/ax, 2.4/5/6 GHz, channels, DFS, channel width
note: Compare Wi-Fi standards, channel planning, DFS, and channel widths. Configure SSIDs and channels on a SOHO AP UI and validate with a Wi-Fi analyzer app.

title: Wireless Security Practices
math: WPA2, WPA3, PSK, 802.1X, EAP, SAE
note: Secure WLANs using WPA2/WPA3, PSK vs Enterprise (802.1X). Configure WPA2-Enterprise with FreeRADIUS on Ubuntu 22.04 and test authentication from a Windows 11 client.

title: WAN Technologies Overview
math: leased lines, packet switching, circuit switching, SLAs, latency
note: Survey major WAN access types and their tradeoffs in cost, throughput, and latency. Use draw.io for diagrams and review real provider SLA examples.

title: MPLS and Metro Ethernet
math: MPLS labels, L3VPN, QoS classes, MetroE E-Line/E-LAN
note: Explain provider MPLS/MetroE offerings and CE responsibilities. Simulate CE routers with FRRouting in GNS3 connected to a mock MPLS cloud.

title: Broadband and Cellular Access
math: DSL, DOCSIS, FTTH, LTE, 5G, CGNAT
note: Contrast DSL, cable, fiber-to-the-home, and LTE/5G. Demonstrate CGNAT detection by comparing a public IP from a website vs your SOHO router status page.

title: NAT and PAT
math: static NAT, dynamic NAT, PAT, hairpin NAT
note: Configure static NAT, dynamic NAT, and PAT including hairpinning. Use pfSense 2.7 in a virtual lab and verify translations with packet captures.

title: DHCP and Relay
math: DORA, scopes, reservations, options, DHCP relay
note: Deploy an ISC DHCP server on Ubuntu 22.04, create scopes and options, set reservations, and configure a DHCP relay on a router. Validate leases and options.

title: DNS Fundamentals
math: A/AAAA, CNAME, MX, TXT, SRV, recursion, caching, TTL
note: Operate BIND9 with forward and reverse zones; create A/AAAA, MX, CNAME, TXT, and SRV records. Test recursion and TTL with dig/nslookup on Windows/Linux.

title: NTP and Time Sync
math: NTP hierarchy, stratum, client/server, authentication
note: Configure chrony on Ubuntu and Windows Time Service to sync with pool.ntp.org. Verify offsets and secure with NTP authentication keys.

title: AAA and Directory Services
math: RADIUS, TACACS+, LDAP, Kerberos, SSO
note: Implement AAA using FreeRADIUS and tac_plus on Ubuntu 22.04; integrate OpenLDAP; test device authentication from a Cisco IOSv router.

title: Firewalls and ACLs
math: stateless vs stateful, zones, rule order, implicit deny
note: Create firewall policies on pfSense and compare with Cisco IOS extended ACLs. Test rule order, logging, and implicit deny using test hosts.

title: IDS/IPS and WAF
math: signature-based, anomaly-based, inline vs TAP, WAF rules
note: Deploy Suricata IDS on Ubuntu; enable community rules and generate test alerts. Discuss managed WAF options using AWS WAF/Azure Front Door examples.

title: Load Balancers and Proxies
math: L4 vs L7, persistence, health checks, reverse proxy, SSL offload
note: Configure HAProxy on Ubuntu to balance HTTP backends with health checks and sticky sessions. Validate with curl and browser tests.

title: QoS Fundamentals
math: DSCP, CoS, queuing, policing, shaping, WRED
note: Classify and mark traffic, apply queuing, policing, and shaping. Use Cisco IOSv in GNS3 to configure MQC policies and test with iperf3 flows.

title: High Availability Gateways
math: HSRP, VRRP, preemption, tracking, failover
note: Configure HSRP/VRRP on two routers and enable preemption and interface tracking. Test gateway failover using continuous pings in GNS3.

title: Routing Basics and Static Routes
math: longest-prefix match, static routes, default route, admin distance
note: Explain longest-prefix match and configure static/default routes. Use FRRouting routers and Linux hosts to verify paths with traceroute and ip route get.

title: RIP for Education
math: RIP v2, split horizon, poison reverse, timers
note: Enable RIP v2 in a small FRRouting topology to illustrate distance-vector metrics and convergence timers; observe route poisoning behavior.

title: OSPF Fundamentals
math: OSPF areas, metrics, adjacencies, DR/BDR, LSAs
note: Configure single-area OSPF with FRRouting; observe neighbor states, DR/BDR elections, and LSDB contents; change interface costs and watch route selection.

title: BGP Essentials
math: eBGP, iBGP, ASNs, path selection, attributes
note: Establish an eBGP peering between FRRouting routers, advertise prefixes, and influence paths with weight, local-preference, and AS-PATH prepending.

title: Route Redistribution and Filtering
math: redistribution, route-maps, prefix-lists, tags, filtering
note: Redistribute between OSPF and BGP in FRRouting using route-maps and prefix-lists; apply route tags to avoid feedback loops.

title: Segmentation with VRFs
math: VRF, routing instances, overlapping IP, route leaking
note: Create VRFs on Cisco IOSv or Linux network namespaces to isolate tenants; selectively leak routes for shared services and test isolation.

title: SDN Concepts
math: control plane, data plane, southbound APIs, OpenFlow, intent
note: Introduce SDN architectures and controller roles. Use Open vSwitch with the Ryu controller on Ubuntu to push simple OpenFlow rules.

title: SD-WAN Fundamentals
math: overlay, underlay, control plane, path selection, policies
note: Explain SD-WAN overlays, control policies, and dynamic path selection. Simulate dual-ISP underlays in GNS3 and observe policy-based failover.

title: Virtualization and vSwitches
math: type 1 vs type 2, vNICs, virtual switches, SR-IOV
note: Build a lab in VMware Workstation or VirtualBox with multiple VMs; configure Linux bridge or Open vSwitch and test inter-VM connectivity.

title: Cloud Networking Models
math: IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, public, private, hybrid, shared responsibility
note: Define cloud service/deployment models and shared responsibility. Use AWS and Azure portals (free tiers) to identify networking components in sample deployments.

title: AWS VPC Networking
math: VPC, subnets, route tables, IGW, NAT gateway, security groups, NACLs
note: Create a VPC with public/private subnets, IGW, NAT gateway, security groups, and NACLs in AWS Console; test EC2 connectivity with ping and curl.

title: Azure VNet Networking
math: VNet, subnets, NSGs, UDR, peering, Bastion
note: Deploy a VNet, subnets, NSGs, and user-defined routes in Azure; peer two VNets and validate connectivity via Azure Cloud Shell.

title: Hybrid Connectivity Options
math: IPsec site-to-site, SSL VPN, Direct Connect, ExpressRoute
note: Set up a site-to-site IPsec VPN between pfSense and AWS. Contrast this with Direct Connect/ExpressRoute features and typical use cases.

title: Automation Basics and APIs
math: REST, JSON, YAML, CRUD, idempotence, API clients
note: Explain RESTful APIs and data formats. Use Postman against a network API sandbox (Cisco DevNet) and parse JSON in Python 3.11.

title: Ansible for Network Automation
math: inventory, modules, playbooks, Jinja2, idempotence
note: Install Ansible 2.15 on Ubuntu; write playbooks using network modules and Jinja2 templates to configure Cisco IOSv/Arista EOS (containerlab or GNS3).

title: Python Network Scripting
math: Netmiko, Paramiko, NAPALM, loops, exceptions
note: Create Python 3.11 scripts with Netmiko/NAPALM to gather device facts and push safe changes; add logging and exception handling. Run from Ubuntu or Windows.

title: Terraform for Networking
math: providers, state, plans, modules, IaC
note: Provision AWS VPC networking with Terraform 1.x. Use providers, plans, remote state, and modules to standardize network deployments.

title: Monitoring with SNMP and Syslog
math: SNMP v2c/v3, OIDs, traps, syslog severities, MIBs
note: Deploy Net-SNMP and syslog-ng on Ubuntu; poll device metrics, receive traps, and forward logs into Graylog for dashboards and alerts.

title: Flow Analysis
math: NetFlow, sFlow, IPFIX, exporters, collectors, top talkers
note: Enable flow export on FRRouting/Cisco IOSv and collect with nfdump or pmacct. Analyze top talkers, applications, and conversations.

title: Wireshark Packet Analysis
math: capture filters, display filters, TCP analysis, follow streams
note: Capture traffic with Wireshark 4 on Windows 11; apply capture/display filters, follow TCP streams, and use conversation statistics to identify latency and retransmissions.

title: Troubleshooting Methodology
math: identification, hypothesis, testing, remediation, verification, documentation
note: Teach a structured troubleshooting process from identification to documentation with clear steps. Use GLPI or Spiceworks to track a mock ticket and actions taken.

title: CLI Troubleshooting Tools
math: ping, traceroute, ipconfig/ifconfig/ip, netstat, nslookup/dig, arp, mtr
note: Demonstrate core tools on Windows and Linux to isolate DNS, gateway, routing, and ARP issues. Practice interpreting outputs and resolving simple faults.

title: Copper Cabling and Connectors
math: UTP/STP, Cat5e/6/6A/7/8, T568A/B, RJ-45, punchdown, patch panels
note: Identify copper media and termination standards. Practice punching down keystones and patch panels with a lab kit and verify with a basic Fluke cable tester.

title: Fiber and Transceivers
math: SMF vs MMF, LC/SC/ST, SFP/SFP+/QSFP, APC vs UPC, link budget
note: Explain fiber types and connector polish. Install SFP modules in lab switches and verify link power budgets and distances per datasheet.

title: Cable Testing and Certification
math: continuity, wiremap, TDR, OTDR, NEXT, return loss, certification
note: Use a cable tester for continuity and wiremap. Discuss TDR/OTDR and interpret sample certification reports using Fluke LinkWare files.

title: Documentation, Diagrams, and Change
math: network diagrams, IPAM, baselines, change control, MOP, SOP
note: Create logical/physical diagrams in draw.io or Visio. Maintain IP addressing in NetBox and write a Method of Procedure for a routine change; run a mock change review.

title: NAC and 802.1X
math: 802.1X, EAP-TLS, PEAP, supplicant, authenticator, RADIUS, posture
note: Deploy FreeRADIUS on Ubuntu and configure 802.1X on a switchport; test EAP-TLS/PEAP with the Windows 11 supplicant and observe RADIUS logs.

title: Zero Trust and Microsegmentation
math: zero trust, least privilege, microsegmentation, SDP, ZTNA
note: Define zero trust principles and implement microsegmentation with host firewalls. Configure Windows Defender Firewall and Linux nftables policies to restrict east-west traffic.

title: Remote Access Methods
math: SSH, RDP, VPN clients, port forwarding, jump hosts
note: Secure remote management with SSH and RDP over VPN. Configure OpenVPN on Windows 11, set port forwarding, and access devices via a hardened jump box.

title: Secure Management and OOB
math: SSH, HTTPS, SNMPv3, TACACS+, out-of-band, console servers
note: Harden management access using SSH/HTTPS and SNMPv3. Demonstrate out-of-band management using a simulated console server and separate management network in GNS3.

title: Network Threats and DDoS
math: DoS, DDoS, amplification, reflection, spoofing, uRPF, RTBH
note: Explain common network attacks and mitigations including ACLs, uRPF, and remotely triggered blackhole (RTBH). Simulate benign load with iperf3 and observe device impact.

title: Vulnerability Scanning and Patching
math: scanning, CVSS, remediation, patch management, exceptions
note: Run OpenVAS or Nessus Essentials against lab hosts; prioritize findings via CVSS and apply patches using apt and Windows Update. Document remediation plans.

title: Incident Response Basics
math: preparation, identification, containment, eradication, recovery, lessons learned
note: Walk through incident response phases using a mock breach. Collect volatile
